edu.ucla.sspace.common

Class SemanticSpaceIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.sspace.common.SemanticSpaceIO

  • public class SemanticSpaceIO
extends Object
    A collection of utility methods for reading and writing SemanticSpace instances. For a full description of the supported formats, see the file formats wiki page.

    When loading a semantic space from a file, this class will automatically try to determine whether its data will fit into memory. If loading the space would exceed the available memory, the space is only partially loaded and its data stays on disk. This allows users to load several semantic spaces at once.

    All of the SemanticSpace instances return by this class are thread safe. In addition they are all unmodifiable due to the limitations of changing the backing data disk. Calls to processDocument and processSpace will result in an UnsupportedOperationException being thrown.

    See Also:
    SemanticSpace, StaticSemanticSpace, OnDiskSemanticSpace

      static class  SemanticSpaceIO.SSpaceFormat

      • load

        public static SemanticSpace load(String sspaceFileName)
                          throws IOException
        Loads and returns the SemanticSpace from the file with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        sspaceFileName - the name of a file containing a SemanticSpace that has been written to disk
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file does not contain an internal format specification
        IOException - if any I/O exception occurs when reading the semantic space data from the file
